website_summaries.verdict: A portable toilet that uses a bag system and folds into its own carrying case.
pros: Has a seat the size of a regular toilet
Fold out legs give it extra height
Made to hold up to 500 pounds
Great for getting on the road
Easy to pack away and take with you
cons: The legs can be a little tricky to get closed
Must be emptied right away if you do not want an odor

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient and sanitary!
customer_reviews.text: We own an Aliner travel trailer without a toilet. This little toilet is very convenient because it folds up when not in use. We set it up either in the trailer at night or outside in our shower tent. We use with the Waag bags, so there is no smell or mess. Just fold up the bag in the morning and toss it out with the trash. I highly recommend this system.
customer_reviews.author: Motown Gal

customer_reviews.title: A great portable toilet for men
customer_reviews.text: Finally, a portable toilet that is most like a regular, home toilet. I bought numerous "bucket" type & folding portable toilets but couldn't find anything that was big enough to accommodate "Man parts" if you know what I mean. They all work well for woman but we all know it's different for men, this is why regular toilets for men have elongated seats. This toilet isn't quite the same as a house toilet, but it comes close. Can also be used as a regular seat with the lid down & folds up to about the size of a larger attache case. Great for vehicle camping!
customer_reviews.author: Theexbrit

customer_reviews.title: Won’t go camping without it
customer_reviews.text: God I love this thing so much that it’s the first thing I show people when I’m showing off my camping gear. What’s so great about this? Well, I have a fear of public restrooms. The stink (when it isn’t your own) just makes me nauseous. I used this when camping out in Colorado when the nearest gas station/convenience store was only a few minutes away because 1. I hate public restrooms that EVERYONE camping would also be using and 2. I couldn’t wait. So I popped this thing out, got in my privacy tent and had the most zen waste eliminating experience of my life right there in the middle of the San Juan national forest.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Easy to fix tabs for closing.
customer_reviews.text: We haven’t used the toilet yet, but it is well made and sturdy. As others have noted, however, you need a pair of pliers to release the tabs that keep the legs upright. That is easily fixed by inverting the unit on a table and shaving the tabs with a box cutter. First, fold the legs back down and shave some off the upper edge of the plastic tabs (towards you). Open and close the legs again and shave some more, and repeat until you can release the tabs with moderate force. You don’t want the legs to collapse in use, but you don’t want to injure your thumbs either trying to fold the legs back down.
customer_reviews.author: L. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Misleading Photo
customer_reviews.text: The snap top cover is depicted in the advertising photo as standing upright on its hinges. It doesn’t do that. It falls backwards and off immediately. Why have it hinged if it isn’t meant to be flipped open and closed? If the bag is good for multiple uses then it would be nice to simply close it like a toilet seat. It would have been so easy to make it functionally friendlier but the designer chose not to do so.
customer_reviews.author: PhilAnders

customer_reviews.title: Game changer for weekend cabin trips
customer_reviews.text: I Like going to our rustic cabin on the weekend and the outhouse nearby is no issue during the day, but when 2:30 am hits and I have to go to the bathroom I HATE CAMPING. Guys just don’t share the issses us girls have about peeing outside in the middle of the night. I used this little potty twice this weekend and it was GREAT never leaving the cabin. Clean up was super easy with the bag set up. The legs did suck folding down but I would gladly do that Sunday morning vs the alternative trek outside Saturday night. Worth the investment girls!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L. Mathena

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Pro: Folds flat making it easy to transport and store. Large seat for comfort. Bag stays in place. Cons: Hard to refold legs. And the biggest cons for me SMELL and waste storage size. Odor starts to linger after just a day of use even with additives. Only used 2 days before the bag was full and had to be change. I'm going back to a toilet bucket I bought at Sportmans Warehouse that holds more and no smell.
customer_reviews.author: D. Read

customer_reviews.title: Built strong
customer_reviews.text: Tri-legged stability is very good for uneven ground. I checked mine out after receiving it and sat on it to test it out. It is a little lower than regular indoor plumbing but workable. It's for emergencies and camping. The legs are a little stiff to extend but click in firmly both ways. It can be a pinching hazard when setting up and breaking down so I would use care and pay attention to finger position. Overall very pleased with the unit.
customer_reviews.author: David P

customer_reviews.title: Vital part missing
customer_reviews.text: We took our new toilet out this weekend at our campsite and discovered that it shipped without the net, a pretty vital part. (See the happy little note.). In addition, the front corner is broken, even though the box was intact. Very poor quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Karen S. Woodworth

customer_reviews.title: Handy, looks like it is sturdy
customer_reviews.text: the toilet seat the is the cover just kinda falls off when lift up. Wish it didn't do that. Would of gave it a 5. Also, it's pretty low. Wish it was 2 inches to 3 inches taller. You feel like you're going down for a squat when you are taller than 5'7"
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea L

customer_reviews.title: Pooping in a hole sucks. This doesn't.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I'm a wuss, but I've pooped in holes enough for one lifetime, so I got this for primitive camping. It folds up the size of a large brief case (remember those?) but opens up to a usable size for morning doodies. It's actually quite sturdy, and I've even used it on the beach. Get some waste bags and you're all set. Unless you like pooping like a bear, then don't waste your time.
customer_reviews.author: Paul H.

customer_reviews.title: easy set up- sturdy
customer_reviews.text: great for camping..used it with a popup toilet shower setup..used kitty litter after each use in the bags that come with it. But plain garbage bags will do just as well. I am tall and heavyish...held my weight just fine.. it is low so for someone with bad knees might be hard.. Folds up neatly
customer_reviews.author: R. R. McDonnell

customer_reviews.title: Great Crapper!
customer_reviews.text: Great crapper, easy to setup, but folding the legs back down can be somewhat cumbersome. I weigh 285, and this unit didnt even flex when I sat on it.
customer_reviews.author: B-Rad

customer_reviews.title: Wish it was easy to fold!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, this is the best portable compact toilet out there. It came with a sample toilet bag and can hold quite a bit of weight. Opening the legs was straightforward and they click behind a tab. But closing them back, you need to press the hard plastic tabs to release the legs, which turned out to be next to impossible without pinching fingers. Finally, we had to use a plier to help fold it back. Wish, there was a better way to design them. The top lid also kept coming loose. Otherwise, this is a very well made toilet.
customer_reviews.author: Kaushik

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly robust
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this thing is awesome. Easy to erect, and very sturdy and comfortable for its intended purpose. I also like that it folds down so flat. However, that it the source of my one complaint - it is really hard to take the legs down. The plastic is very stiff, and I have to use a flathead screwdriver to exert enough force to get the legs to fold, and it’s a bummer to have to carry extra parts for this.
customer_reviews.author: Lavender

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: The legs are impossible to fold down!!!! Takes up way too much room in my van. When I asked for a refund they said theyd tell me how to fold them, but I have not heard back. This is a purchase I regret.
customer_reviews.author: Rebel

customer_reviews.title: legs are difficult to fold up
customer_reviews.text: you need really good thumb or forefinger strength to release the plastic sections holdings the legs open. The center leg is an absolute sod of the thing to close up, for a 68 year old male.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony J. Hitchings

customer_reviews.title: Completely worth your money!
customer_reviews.text: This transformed our camping trip for me. I put it right inside our tent in the corner as I go to the bathroom OFTEN during the night. My 6 year olds used it, too, and it was a luxury to not have to find their shoes, put them on, find a place we could go, etc... It was completely worth the money in 1 night. I did take 1 star off because the legs are SO hard to fold down. But a breeze to set up!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Road Trip Relief!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to support road trips (many rest stop rest rooms were initially closed during onset of COVID) and camping. Works very well and when on the road, you can remain isolated from others by not having to use public rest rooms. I don’t find the leg releases too difficult to operate but they do require some pressure to release. Very sturdy when setup and the bag/disposal system is quite good.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: A
customer_reviews.text: This works perfect for the overlander/ camper. I like its compactness iit fits perfect in the back of my JK. I just wish they would make the legs a little easier to open and close other than that it works as advertised. I do think they could fix those issues after all it is pricey for a plastic toilet lol.
customer_reviews.author: Raptor4

customer_reviews.title: May be a great help, but way too low for a big person....
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this toilet and it does feel like it's a high quality build. However the seat is only 14 inches high once assembled, you're going to need something around you to pull up from. Also, once assembled the legs are a pain to fold back, but that may just be me. Over all you can call it a heavy duty toilet built for skinny people.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Hewitt

customer_reviews.title: Very stable / easy to set up and use...Folds up compactly
customer_reviews.text: Used this for @ 5 days this summer while camping at rustic cabin that only had outhouse...This was far more preferable! No problems using/ no accidents...just make sure you are on solid ground... Fits easily under RV as backup - and will always have this - plus a supply of “WAG Bags” for use in emergencies.
customer_reviews.author: Dan R

customer_reviews.title: Toilet for trucker.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for OTR trucking. When truck stops or ready areas are full/not available this is a great alternative. The compact size and light weight is great for stowing it away while until needed, without sacrafice in sturdiness or stability.
customer_reviews.author: JSteele

customer_reviews.title: Seems sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be very sturdy, but I agree with the other reviews that say it's hard to close the legs. The two back legs seem to have tabs you can press to push them in, but the single front leg does not. It would be easy to add tabs to that one so you could close it without putting too much pressure on it (which will cause it to weaken). This would be so much more functional if it could be closed up more easily. The whole purpose of it is to be portable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The system works very well, and is so much ...
customer_reviews.text: The system works very well, and is so much nicer than the conventional Porta-Potty. A few caveats: 1) do buy additional powder. The bags sometimes don't have enough powder to jell the liquid for two adults over night. 2) We needed wide-jawed pliers to collapse the two rear legs on our model. There was no way I could squeeze the tabs by hand to collapse the legs. The single front leg was a bit of a struggle, but no big problem.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent online shopper

customer_reviews.title: Compact and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Simply to set up. sat on it a few times and it seems very sturdy. I tried to order more waste bags but for some reason they would not ship to my address in CA? Very happy with the toilet purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MR

customer_reviews.title: Great outdoor option
customer_reviews.text: We carry this on our camping trips. We're always out where there's nothing. You just use the supplied bags with some sort of deodorizer and it makes like very easy. I'm a big guy at 230lbs and it hold my weight just fine. The size of a briefcase. Don't leave home without it.
customer_reviews.author: Eliot Vancil

customer_reviews.title: Two legs need upfront only one in back flip it
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a while and I realize the two legs should probably be on the front part where all the weight is in the one leg should be on the back where there is no wait most people sit on the front part of the seat just a thought. Anyway now the one leg is broken I need a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: hacks illumine

customer_reviews.title: Gets the Job Done
customer_reviews.text: I used this for the first time taking only one waste pack for a two night camping trip. I suggest you need one bag per day, or as some others recommended, take a jar of poo powder with you to add to the bag. The powder in one bag does not jell a lot of waste. It is much easier to take care of than a liquid chemical porta-pot. 9/7/14 Update - I purchased a jar of poo powder. I was able to use one waste pack for an entire weekend of camping, although not for number 1's. Just number 2's. I really like the easy of this compared to a chemical toliet.
customer_reviews.author: Spike

customer_reviews.title: Make potty time happy time
customer_reviews.text: Was turned on to this by a freind who had one on a group trip this summer. Awesome. Ability to use, then pack and seal in double bag system is worth its weight in gold. We carried two bags in the van back home with us and there was no trace of smell whatsoever. The bag system is a bit shallow, so you have to use caution when wiping as it approaches capacity, but that's a small price to pay for not having to dig cat holes. Definitely a must have for places like Moab where cat hole digging is prohibited.
customer_reviews.author: Wade Bigall

customer_reviews.title: Comes with a large package of Clean Waste for at least 10 uses.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. Could use a 4th leg. If you lean to one side or the other, you'll find that it wants to tip. So keep your center of gravity centered. Good quality materials. Folds up nicely, easy to throw in the back of your car, RV, or whatever. Easy to change the waste bag, without touching contents. Generally a good buy. 4 stars instead of 5 because it needs 4 legs.
customer_reviews.author: MotherHen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Hold my big butt up and it's easy to store. I'm around 300 lbs and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best portable toilet I've seen.
customer_reviews.text: This portable toilet is so much better than my previous camp toilet (which was a very uncomfortable bucket with a very small seat.) ! It is everything it is advertised to be; easy to set up and take down, is very sturdy and comfortable, takes up very little space when transporting and uses a simple disposable bag system. And was very reasonable. I use kitty litter in mine and have found very inexpensive and efficient bags at Walmart that are just as effective as the more expensive brands. I'd recommend this item to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Redbird

customer_reviews.title: Great system!
customer_reviews.text: I have used a chemical toilet for years, and will NEVER go back after using this system. For camping and overlanding, this is the responsible yet easy/no hassle system. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Pfadt

customer_reviews.title: Great option for outdoors.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to store, carry and use. Well built. When you use the bags from the same manufacturer it have a complete system. Great for outdoor use. A must if you have kids and are active.
customer_reviews.author: Good Guy

customer_reviews.title: Okay - but there are better ones on the market that are cheaper and don't have odor problems
customer_reviews.text: This is sturdy - However, I think this is way over priced compared to Walmart portable toilets - wish I had shopped around more - the powder does not work at all for odor - and thus this stinks if you do not empty it right away - will be replacing with one for $59 that is odorless (verifed by reviews), and does not have the additonal cost of the bags
customer_reviews.author: DB0918

customer_reviews.title: The best camp portal for your #2!
customer_reviews.text: Nobody likes talking about #2, but this tool is a great solution. Comfortable, stable and sturdy is all you need to know.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Cryer

customer_reviews.title: A great idea and it really works.
customer_reviews.text: This toilet is easy to setup, easy to use and it keeps the odors contained. I went for 4 stars rather than 5 since the single leg is tricky to collapse. I usually have to find a screwdriver.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Slattery

customer_reviews.title: My husband laughed at me for buying this, until HE had to use it!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this thing. It makes going to the bathroom while camping super easy. Combine it with a shelter (or not!), it's the perfect toilet away from home, easy to pack, carry and requires minimal space. Built to last!
customer_reviews.author: I. Underwood

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to our Earthquake prep kit
customer_reviews.text: While we haven't had occasion to actually use this device yet, it appears to be very functional, and ideal for our emergency preparedness kit. With three women in the house, I thought it important to have something convenient for them to use in the event of a disaster like an earthquake, where water and / or safe access to toilets would suddenly no longer be available. This and a free-standing, portable "closet" tent means we'll be able to set up an outhouse of sorts, anywhere we need to.
customer_reviews.author: Tourpilot

customer_reviews.title: Great for avoiding public restrooms
customer_reviews.text: We recently purchased this for a road trip/camping trip to help avoid Public restrooms during Covid. It worked great, easy to set up, transport and clean. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because you do have to be careful with younger users because it can tip over rather easily.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy. Not to low to the ground
customer_reviews.text: Portable and light weight. Sturdy. Not to low to the ground. Made our camping much more pleasant. The bags you use hold up well for they tuck and there is a mesh under toilet to help hold the weight. The bags have a powder that turns the waste in to gel so no leakage when removed. The bag has odor control too. Great Deals Found Here. A+ A+ A+ Fast Shipment !!!
customer_reviews.author: Jay Margotte

customer_reviews.title: Very practical
customer_reviews.text: This toilet is easy to assemble and to use but low to the ground. To be comfortable you need to put it on a higher surface, other wise for a guy of 70 years old it is hard to get up after your business is over.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Need iron hands to close the legs.
customer_reviews.text: No complaints, but may pose difficulty for many trying to pinch the leg tabs to close. Especially, the middle leg. I gave Strong hands, but it's still hard to close the one.
customer_reviews.author: Jeh

customer_reviews.title: Great for car camping, road trips, rafting
customer_reviews.text: Great potty for camping / raft trips; it's not too hard to set up (the legs do clip in firmly when set up, which I appreciate) - just wiggle here, press there, and the legs will give in. My only complaint is that the lid falls off when open - seems it broke, or arrived broken, and doesn't fit in snuggly, but it's not a deal killer.
customer_reviews.author: Calypso

customer_reviews.title: they must have had a good laugh out of it
customer_reviews.text: so, going camping this weekend, ordered this toilet, just got it, no problem on delivery time, open it up to check it out, and this paper is taped to the unit = i read it, and only words i had was REALLY ? , and the note, they must have had a good laugh out of it, knowing you cant use it, but here you go,,, did anyone have this happen and any info on what you could do without the mesh holding bag ?
customer_reviews.author: paul marshall

customer_reviews.title: Works to hold the stuff I don't want anymore
customer_reviews.text: It's solid feeling even with a fat dude sitting on it, it folds up small and cleans well. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Just what this camper wanted!
customer_reviews.text: We've just started adventuring in a vintage '59 camper that has no "facilities." This was a must for me and it's so convenient. I checked out other types of porta-pottys, but didn't want to deal with dumping and cleaning (bleh!) So this system, using a regular kitchen garbage bag and the marvelous Cleanwaste Mini Poo Powder, works great!
customer_reviews.author: Great Lakes Gal

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for camping
customer_reviews.text: This worked out great. I felt a bit unsteady when sitting but not once did it tip over. The lid did not want to stay up. I would just take it off and lay it back on top when I was done. Love how compact it stores
customer_reviews.author: DDMB

customer_reviews.title: Perfect transaction and great product
customer_reviews.text: Perfect transaction and great product! Use this product in the desert and out of bounds trips.. I like it better than typical 5 gal toilets with seats. Pretty low to the ground though. Taller folks will have to squat pretty low unless you put a platform underneath. Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: d

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but be prepared to leave it open
customer_reviews.text: Despite the reviews about it being hard to open and close, I decided to risk it because of the ease in carrying it and the reported stability. When I got it, I was pleased because it wasn't hard opening the legs at all, and it was very stable. However, it is nearly impossible to release the legs to close it. It took 2 people to do it, one with a vice group. If one wanted to keep it someplace and not transport it, it would be fine. However, what's the point of having a nice portable toilet if you can't close it? I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: swimmer25

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't look sturdy but it is
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our bathroom remodel & house repiping project since our one toilet was out almost a week, and it was worth every penny. Doesn't look sturdy but it is. The TP packets are silly so use your own roll of TP. The bags to go with it are great as it minimizes the "gross factor" and seriously the bags do NOT smell once you seal 'em!
customer_reviews.author: EcoGrrl

customer_reviews.title: Great family camp pooper!
customer_reviews.text: 4x4 camping in Big Ben with the family.. Used with a pop-up hunting blind for privacy. Worked well for my wife, tween daughter and son. Gel worked great.
customer_reviews.author: COREGROUND

customer_reviews.title: Must Have when Kid Camping!
customer_reviews.text: We keep this in our Jeep. Once we stayed at a campsite that had bathrooms you had to walk to, but 3 kids got all kinds of sick on this trip. Having this inside the tent/yurt made life slightly less messy. It was also nice to have camping when camping with other people I don't know as well. It is a little low for most grown men and my husband thinks the privacy tent we bought for it is cramped for him. I picked up extra blue bags (15) and poo powder for a reasonable price at our local Sporting Goods store.
customer_reviews.author: Estina Martin

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up portable toilet for day trips
customer_reviews.text: So easy to set up! I used this during the Coronavirus situation to do day trips. I purchased this toilet along with the pop up privacy tent. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah L. Richards

customer_reviews.title: Essential after main headliner night
customer_reviews.text: I'd pay 100 bucks to not use a wrecked Porto after the headliner at a festival. Rarely used but so worth it
customer_reviews.author: Akitafun

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE this
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE this! We bought this for our van to tailgate with, and its compact, comfortable, easy to clean and Most Importantly....I don't worry about any mess because it's very sturdy and the bags fit underneath the seat locked in and not messy! I didn't give it 5 stars, because the legs are hard to snap out, otherwise it's worth the investment and I'd buy again!!
customer_reviews.author: Candice Dempsey

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely worth the money to have a toilet at the campsite. This is sturdy and easy to use. I bought Poo Powder and a roll of 4 gallon plastic bags, which I use inside a grocery sack to make sure there are no surprise spills when cleaning up. Makes camping much easier.
customer_reviews.author: frequent shopper

customer_reviews.title: This is a sturdy unit
customer_reviews.text: It arrived on time and was as described by the seller. I am a big fella and it is plenty sturdy and you can clean it easily
customer_reviews.author: Claude Little

customer_reviews.title: Compact
customer_reviews.text: Great sturdy, compact item to use camping or long haul traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: It works well with no mess and folds up compactly with a nice carrying handle
customer_reviews.text: Quality product for when you are away from a full service campground. It works well with no mess and folds up compactly with a nice carrying handle. Money well spent for backcountry excursions!
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Roy Sr.

customer_reviews.title: works great!
customer_reviews.text: This is almost as convenient as using a regular commode. I don't get the problems people seem to be having opening and closing the legs. My wife didn't even have a problem with it. It's easy to carry and setup.
customer_reviews.author: revelstone77

customer_reviews.title: Easy to transport !
customer_reviews.text: The toilet is well made, compact and is easy to transport . My preference would be that the legs were longer, i have made 3 inch blocks to put under the legs .
customer_reviews.author: E. Locke

customer_reviews.title: A well made product!!
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used yet , but looks like a very good product!!
customer_reviews.author: Al Dillard

customer_reviews.title: Just what was needed
customer_reviews.text: This worked great on our camping trip. It is sturdy and holds 250+ weight. Not smelly either. The only drawbacks I found were 1) the powder-to-gel mixture was just dumped loose in the plastic bag so when opened it all fell out. (Didn't matter because I used kitty litter anyway. ) 2) could use rubber on the bottom of the feet/legs to keep slipping on wood or tile floor at a minimum.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Weak plastic - leg snapped when closing it
customer_reviews.text: The leg broke when I was closing it. The plastic just warped and snapped. I'm not strong or heavy handed. That was only third time using it so very poor outcome.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Murray

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: You can sit on this and poop into a plastic bag.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Adds a much more "comfortable" dimension to outdoor camping. East to use and clean up in a snap.
customer_reviews.author: JF

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and does the job
customer_reviews.text: Order this for my brother who does a lot of traveling and is trying to save money he’s a tall guy and says it’s pretty sturdy and it will do the job
customer_reviews.author: MissCC324

customer_reviews.title: No more cat holes!
customer_reviews.text: I have dug a lot of cat holes in my life, this works great for me now. Very sturdy and cleans well.
customer_reviews.author: Sierraman TRVLNUS

customer_reviews.title: Great for people with good knees and hips
customer_reviews.text: Well made, sturdy, good design. Too low for me. people with bad knees or hips need to get something taller. Otherwise this is great.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie Massie

customer_reviews.title: Just as described
customer_reviews.text: We decided not to keep this toilet. However the design is very nice and its compact fold up easy to carry and comfortable to sit on
customer_reviews.author: Sue H.

customer_reviews.title: Not the height advertised
customer_reviews.text: This was advertised as a comfortable height. Not so. Don’t like having to squat down so low. Could have been designed at normal toilet height.
customer_reviews.author: Charles George

customer_reviews.title: More refills need to be included with initial purchase
customer_reviews.text: Two adults used this in a pop up tent trailer @ night and it was the perfect addition to our camping gear. Was a little worried about the plastic legs supporting us but it did just fine. Down side they give you one bag and the refills are ridiculously priced so we used kitchen catchers & they did the job just fine!
customer_reviews.author: J Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Rugged, but can tip over during normal use.
customer_reviews.text: Careful! With only three legs, when you go to wipe yourself it feels like the whole unit will tip over.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the alternative!
customer_reviews.text: This item makes camping and hiking deep in the forest much more comfortable. Handy size, folds into a flat briefcase size with a hand; set up easy and plenty sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Jack Killough

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for travel
customer_reviews.text: We went off grid camping and this toilet was a must. Perfect for the ladies!!
